summary: The Statue of Zeus at Olympia was a huge, 41-foot tall sculpture made around 435 BC by the Greek artist Phidias. It showed Zeus, the king of the gods, sitting on a fancy throne. The statue was made of ivory, gold, and wood, and was one of the most famous wonders of the ancient world. Unfortunately, it was lost and destroyed before the 6th century AD. We only know what it looked like from ancient descriptions and pictures on coins.
title: Statue of Zeus at Olympia
